description: This is a Python source file implementing a command-line interface (CLI) for a project initializer tool named 'UniversalProject Initializer'. It defines argument parsing, input processing, project configuration creation, and project initialization logic, with support for various project types. The script manages the flow from user input to invoking project template creation and initialization, printing diagnostic info and outputting JSON status results.

methods.name: Dict[str,Any] parse_parameters(params_str: str)
methods.description: Parses a comma-separated key=value string into a dictionary with appropriate type conversions (bool, int, float).

methods.name: ProjectConfig create_project_config(args)
methods.description: Creates a ProjectConfig object from CLI arguments, including parsing parameters.

methods.name: str make_path_absolute(path: str, base_path: Path)
methods.description: Converts a relative path to an absolute path based on a given base directory.

methods.name: dict template_init_info_to_dict(init_info: TemplateInitInfo, project_path: Path)
methods.description: Serializes a TemplateInitInfo instance into a dictionary with paths converted to absolute paths.

methods.name: output_json(success: bool, message: str, template_info: TemplateInitInfo = None, project_path: Path = None)
methods.description: Formats and prints a JSON output with success status, message, and optional template info.

methods.name: main()
methods.description: Main function: sets up argument parsing, creates project configuration, generates template info, executes initialization, and outputs the result.

ctags.name: output_json
ctags.pattern: /^def output_json(success: bool, message: str, template_info: TemplateInitInfo = None, project_pat/
ctags.signature: (success: bool, message: str, template_info: TemplateInitInfo = None, project_path: Path = None)
